explanation: Include the target's direct callees (lfs_fs_desuperblock, lfs_fs_demove, lfs_fs_deorphan) because any of them could directly call back to lfs_fs_forceconsistency (direct recursion). Include each function that those callees call (the remaining symbols) because an indirect recursion path can pass through one or more of these functions back to lfs_fs_forceconsistency. In particular: - lfs_dir_commit, lfs_dir_fetch, lfs_fs_prepmove, lfs_fs_preporphans, lfs_fs_parent, lfs_dir_get, lfs_dir_orphaningcommit, lfs_dir_getgstate are filesystem-level routines that commonly invoke higher-level consistency functions; they must be examined to see if they (directly or transitively) call lfs_fs_forceconsistency. - gstate/tag/pair helpers (lfs_gstate_*, lfs_tag_*, lfs_pair_*) and conversions (lfs_pair_tole32, lfs_pair_fromle32, lfs_superblock_tole32, lfs_fs_disk_version) are included because they appear in the callee lists and could themselves call other routines that form an indirect cycle. Analyzing these symbols provides the transitive call graph necessary to determine whether any path from lfs_fs_forceconsistency leads back to itself (violating MISRA recursion prohibition).
